User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Vidyalaya Connect application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

role.description: The role of the user (e.g., teacher, parent, student, administrator).

Notice.title: Notice
Notice.description: Represents a notice or announcement on the Notice Board.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Notice entity.

authorId.description: The user ID of the author of the notice.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the notice was created.

role.description: The role this notice is intended for (All, Teachers, Students, Parents)

Fee.title: Fee
Fee.description: Represents a quarterly fee payment for a student.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Fee entity.

quarter.description: The quarter for which the fee is for (e.g., q1, q2, q3, q4).

status.description: The payment status of the fee.

paymentDate.description: The date the fee was paid.

LiveClass.title: Live Class
LiveClass.description: Represents an ongoing live class session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the live class session.

teacherId.description: The ID of the teacher conducting the class.

class.description: The class for which the session is intended.

meetingLink.description: The URL for the video conference (e.g., Google Meet, Zoom).

status.description: The current status of the class.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the class started.

Video.title: Video
Video.description: Represents an uploaded or generated video in the gallery.

description.description: A short description of the video.

videoUrl.description: The URL of the video file or embed link.

thumbnailUrl.description: The URL for the video thumbnail image.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the video was added.

createdBy.description: Name of the user who added the video.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to securely manage users and notices for the Vidyalaya Connect application, prioritizing authorization independence and clear security rules. User data is stored in a dedicated collection (`/users/{userId}`) with path-based ownership, ensuring only the user can access their own data. Notices are stored in a top-level `notices` collection for easy querying across the app. Security rules will filter notices based on the logged-in user's role and the `role` property on the notice document itself, ensuring users only see relevant announcements. A new 'fees' collection is added to manage student fee payments. A 'live-classes' collection is added to manage live video class sessions. A 'videos' collection is added to store video gallery content.
